title: Phase 1: High-Priority Command & Parser Improvements
body:
## Overview

Address high-priority command enhancements and parser fixes to improve PennMUSH compatibility and user experience.

## Priority

**HIGH** - User-facing improvements

## Effort Estimate

32-48 hours (2-3 weeks)

## Components

### Command Enhancements (16-24h)

- Room/obj format support (GeneralCommands.cs) - 2-3h
- Attribute value validation - 1-2h
- Database query optimizations - 4-6h
- Channel visibility improvements - 2-3h
- Parent/zone relationship handling - 1-2h
- Admin command implementations (WizardCommands.cs) - 8-12h

### Parser Fixes (6-9h)

- ansi() replacement ordering fix (SharpMUSHParserVisitor.cs) - 2-3h
- QREG evaluation string processing - 2-3h
- Parser edge case handling - 2-3h

### Service Improvements (4-6h)

- LocateService logic review and correction - 2-3h
- Service optimizations - 2-3h

### Testing (6-9h)

- Test high-priority fixes
- Verify PennMUSH compatibility
- Edge case validation

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Room/obj format matches PennMUSH output
- [ ] Attribute validation working correctly
- [ ] Database queries optimized
- [ ] Channel visibility implemented
- [ ] ansi() ordering fixed
- [ ] QREG evaluation working
- [ ] LocateService logic correct
- [ ] All tests passing
- [ ] No regressions introduced

## Dependencies

None - can start immediately

## Notes

These are the highest priority improvements for production deployment. Focus on user-facing features and PennMUSH compatibility.

title: Phase 2: Function Implementation Completeness
body:
## Overview

Complete MEDIUM priority function implementations including server integration, websocket communication, and string processing.

## Priority

**MEDIUM** - Feature completeness

## Effort Estimate

24-38 hours (1.5-2.5 weeks)

## Components

### Utility Functions (8-14h)

- Server integration features (UtilityFunctions.cs) - 3-4h
- Text file system integration - 2-3h
- Formatting improvements - 1-2h
- Tree structure handling - 1h
- Markup parsing improvements - 1-2h

### Communication Functions (6-9h)

- Websocket/out-of-band HTML communication (HTMLFunctions.cs) - 4-6h
- Websocket/JSON communication (JSONFunctions.cs) - 2-3h

### String Functions (2-4h)

- Character iteration functions (StringFunctions.cs) - 1-2h
- ansi() handling improvements - 1-2h

### Database Functions (4-6h)

- Attribute pattern handling - 2-3h
- Database pattern support - 2-3h

### Testing (4-5h)

- Function test coverage
- Integration testing
- Edge case validation

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Server integration working
- [ ] Text file system integrated
- [ ] Websocket communication implemented
- [ ] JSON communication functional
- [ ] Character iteration complete
- [ ] Pattern handling working
- [ ] All function tests passing
- [ ] No performance regressions

## Dependencies

- Phase 1 completion recommended
- Server infrastructure availability

## Notes

These features enhance SharpMUSH's functionality but are not required for basic operation.

title: Phase 2: Service Infrastructure Enhancements
body:
## Overview

Complete service layer enhancements including listen patterns, SQL support, and database handling.

## Priority

**MEDIUM** - Infrastructure completeness

## Effort Estimate

16-24 hours (1-1.5 weeks)

## Components

### Listen Pattern Matcher (4-6h)

- Parent checking implementation (ListenPatternMatcher.cs) - 2-3h
- API completion - 2-3h

### SQL Service (2-3h)

- Multiple database type support (SqlService.cs) - 2-3h

### Database Interface (1-2h)

- Attribute pattern return handling (ISharpDatabase.cs) - 1-2h

### Helper Functions (1-2h)

- Pattern and regex pattern splitting (HelperFunctions.cs) - 1-2h

### Other Services (4-6h)

- Various service improvements - 4-6h

### Testing (4-5h)

- Service integration tests
- Database compatibility tests
- Pattern matching validation

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Parent checking working in listen patterns
- [ ] Listen pattern API complete
- [ ] Multiple database types supported
- [ ] Attribute patterns handled correctly
- [ ] Pattern splitting implemented
- [ ] All service tests passing
- [ ] Database compatibility verified

## Dependencies

- Database infrastructure
- Pattern matching system

## Notes

These enhancements improve the service layer's robustness and flexibility.

title: Phase 2: Parser & Evaluator Improvements
body:
## Overview

Implement MEDIUM priority parser improvements including evaluation modes, context switching, and stack management.

## Priority

**MEDIUM** - Parser completeness

## Effort Estimate

18-27 hours (1-1.7 weeks)

## Components

### Evaluation Handling (6-9h)

- Eval vs noparse evaluation (SharpMUSHParserVisitor.cs) - 2-3h
- ibreak() placement evaluation - 2-3h
- Evaluation context improvements - 2-3h

### Context & Stack (6-9h)

- Context switching improvements - 2-3h
- Stack management enhancements - 2-3h
- Stack rewinding mechanism - 2-3h

### Pattern Integration (2-3h)

- Pattern matching integration - 2-3h

### Recursion Handling (2-4h)

- Recursion and invocation limits - 2-4h

### Testing (2-3h)

- Parser edge case tests
- Evaluation mode validation
- Stack behavior verification

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Eval and noparse modes working correctly
- [ ] ibreak() evaluation placement correct
- [ ] Context switching functional
- [ ] Stack management robust
- [ ] Stack rewinding implemented
- [ ] Pattern matching integrated
- [ ] Recursion limits working
- [ ] All parser tests passing

## Dependencies

- Pattern matching system
- Core parser infrastructure

## Notes

These improvements enhance parser robustness and handle edge cases more gracefully.

title: Phase 2: Command Feature Enhancements
body:
## Overview

Implement MEDIUM priority command enhancements including database search, pattern matching, and advanced features.

## Priority

**MEDIUM** - Command completeness

## Effort Estimate

28-42 hours (1.8-2.6 weeks)

## Components

### Database Operations (8-12h)

- Full database search filters (GeneralCommands.cs) - 3-4h
- Database statistics queries - 2-3h
- Object linking queries - 2-3h

### Pattern & Matching (4-6h)

- Pattern matching integration - 2-3h
- Match handling improvements - 2-3h

### Advanced Features (8-12h)

- NOBREAK switch handling - 1-2h
- Retroactive copy updates - 1-2h
- Default flag checking - 1-2h
- Default attribute flag checking - 1-2h
- Semaphore attribute validation - 1-2h
- Exit teleporting - 2-3h
- Target player location display - 1-2h

### Money & Transfers (2-3h)

- Money transfer implementation (MoreCommands.cs) - 2-3h

### Testing (6-9h)

- Command feature tests
- Database query validation
- Pattern matching tests

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Database search filters working
- [ ] Database statistics accurate
- [ ] Object linking queries functional
- [ ] Pattern matching integrated
- [ ] NOBREAK switch working
- [ ] Retroactive updates functional
- [ ] Flag checking implemented
- [ ] Exit teleporting working
- [ ] Money transfers functional
- [ ] All command tests passing

## Dependencies

- Database infrastructure
- Pattern matching system

## Notes

These enhancements add advanced command features for power users.

title: Phase 3: Test Suite Completion
body:
## Overview

Complete test coverage by implementing skipped tests and adding edge case validation.

## Priority

**LOW** - Test coverage

## Effort Estimate

15-25 hours (1-1.6 weeks)

## Components

### Command Tests (7-12h)

- GeneralCommandTests.cs skipped tests - 7-12h

### Parser Tests (3-5h)

- RecursionAndInvocationLimitTests.cs - 3-5h

### Function Tests (4-6h)

- StringFunctionUnitTests.cs - 2-3h
- ListFunctionUnitTests.cs - 2-3h

### Other Tests (1-2h)

- Various test improvements - 1-2h

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] All skipped tests investigated
- [ ] Test coverage increased
- [ ] Edge cases covered
- [ ] All tests passing
- [ ] Test infrastructure improved
- [ ] Test documentation complete

## Dependencies

- Feature implementations complete

## Notes

These tests improve overall code quality and catch edge cases.

title: Phase 3: Handler Implementations
body:
## Overview

Implement remaining handler functionality including Telnet protocols and database persistence.

## Priority

**LOW** - Handler completeness

## Effort Estimate

6-10 hours (0.4-0.6 weeks)

## Components

### Telnet Handlers (3-6h)

- MSSP handler implementation (TelnetMSSPHandler.cs) - 1-2h
- MSDP handler implementation (TelnetMSDPHandler.cs) - 1-2h
- Output handler implementation (TelnetOutputHandler.cs) - 1-2h

### Other Handlers (3-4h)

- Database warnings persistence (SetObjectWarningsCommandHandler.cs) - 1-2h
- Socket disconnect banner (SocketCommands.cs) - 1h
- Mail AMAIL trigger (SendMail.cs) - 1-2h

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] MSSP handler working
- [ ] MSDP handler working
- [ ] Output handler working
- [ ] Database warnings persisted
- [ ] Disconnect banner displayed
- [ ] AMAIL trigger functional
- [ ] All handler tests passing

## Dependencies

- Telnet infrastructure
- Database persistence layer

## Notes

These handlers add protocol support and persistence features.

title: Phase 3: Code Quality & Polish
body:
## Overview

Address remaining LOW priority TODOs including code cleanup, minor improvements, and documentation.

## Priority

**LOW** - Code quality

## Effort Estimate

20-30 hours (1.3-1.9 weeks)

## Components

### Parser Minor Enhancements (2-3h)

- Minor parser improvements - 2-3h

### Function Improvements (4-6h)

- Attribute pattern handling - 2-3h
- Database pattern support - 2-3h

### Service Improvements (3-6h)

- Helper functions - 1-2h
- Minor service enhancements - 2-4h

### Register Tests (2-3h)

- RegistersUnitTests.cs improvements - 2-3h

### Input Consumers (3-4h)

- InputMessageConsumers.cs enhancements - 3-4h

### Miscellaneous (3-5h)

- Various code quality improvements - 3-5h

### Documentation (3-3h)

- Code documentation updates - 3-3h

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Code cleanup complete
- [ ] Minor improvements implemented
- [ ] Documentation updated
- [ ] Code quality improved
- [ ] All tests passing
- [ ] No technical debt added

## Dependencies

None

## Notes

These improvements polish the codebase and improve maintainability.

title: Phase 4: Complete Remaining 7 Administrative Commands
body:
## Overview

Implement the 7 remaining administrative commands based on operational needs.

## Priority

**LOW** - Optional administrative features

## Effort Estimate

15-30 hours (1-2 weeks)

## Commands

1. **@ALLHALT** - Emergency halt all queued commands (2-4h)
2. **@CHOWNALL** - Change ownership of all objects (2-4h)
3. **@POLL** - Polling/survey system (3-5h)
4. **@PURGE** - Purge inactive objects (2-4h)
5. **@READCACHE** - Display cache statistics (1-2h)
6. **@SHUTDOWN** - Server shutdown (2-3h)
7. **@SUGGEST** - Suggestion system (3-5h)

## Testing

- Command functionality tests (3-5h)
- Permission validation (1-2h)
- Integration testing (1-2h)

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] All 7 commands implemented
- [ ] Command help documentation
- [ ] Permission checks working
- [ ] All tests passing
- [ ] PennMUSH compatibility verified
- [ ] No security issues

## Dependencies

- Queue system
- Database infrastructure
- Permission system

## Notes

Implement these commands based on operational need and user requests. Not required for production deployment.
